Transcribed 11.5.93. To proof.
Melbourne bot Garden,

In the Flora Tasmanica occurs a remark, dear Mr Gunn that the fruits, of which you sent as likely belonging to Amphiboles zosterifolia (or Ruppia antarctica Labill), were probably referable to Posidonia australis. This seems to have been the cause, that Dr Ascherson very recently in Becaris italian giornale combined my Amphobolis zostrifolia with Posidonia australis. I found only once a single fruit of Amphibates, very similar certainly to that of Posidonia australis, which letter plant I found abundantly in fruit at King Georges Sound in 1867. May I now ask of you to see whether you have in your collection left any fruit specimens for comparison with my plants, to clear up any errors. I may remark, that in the 6th vol. of the Fragmenta I rejected the name Posidonia in favor of the older generic name Canlenia.
